website_summaries.verdict: Great price for a GMC road bike that's made for average sized men. Ships with everything you need.
pros: Uses a lightweight aluminum frame, yet it offers the sturdiness of a road bike
Features a 21-speed riding system, so you can pick the right gear for the situation
Makes use of Shimano shifters and derailleurs for quality
Best fit for riders from 5 feet 8 inches to 6 feet 2 inches in height
cons: Not really made for average-sized women
May not last when used in rough environments

customer_reviews.title: Priced appropriately for a starter Road Bike.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly and undamaged. Easy assembly. Required adjustments for brakes and bottom bracket which are all basic fixes/repairs.
customer_reviews.author: ittybittylily

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike. The ride is smooth and the look/finish is great. Excellent value
customer_reviews.author: Kris Coombs Sr

customer_reviews.title: Front tire wont hold air // no help from seller
customer_reviews.text: bought the bike. The front tire will not hold air. The seller will not help. Highly recommended you find another seller.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Needed an inexpensive, entry-level bike to use during training for a triathlon. This thing has been great. Shifts smoother than my mountain bike which also has grip shifters. Frame is rigid and let's you but the power down well. Did have to adjust the brakes to get maximum stopping power, buts that not uncommon with rim brakes. I put about 200 miles on this baby ahead of the triathlon, which I completed this weekend, and this baby was rock steady throughout. Looking forward to putting a lot more miles on this baby.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon & Cacia

customer_reviews.title: BEST $200 ROAD BIKE !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and literally got it the day it shipped! Plan on using this for 20 - 50 mile bike rides. It’s self explanatory to put together took me 30 minutes. Rides pretty good I’ll keep y’all updated on here! 7 Months later: So I’ve been riding this bike hundreds of miles and recently just rode a 60 mile bike race - 100k (firecracker 100) and I haven’t had to change the tires or anything. Bike works great and again, highly suggest for beginners/advanced riders.
customer_reviews.author: Briston

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction and unreliable company
customer_reviews.text: This bike looks nice but first time it was ridden a bent front fork revealed itself which caused the front wheel to nearly scrape the frame and hit my toes on peddles...needless to say it had to be replaced. Upon calling customer service in New Jersey I was informed they had the part but it would cost $45 to have it sent to California. My bad since I had paid cash and had no receipt even though I gave company the serial # and they could see it was new and not stolen.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wayne Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Smooth ride
customer_reviews.text: Purchased from my local Walmart for $179. Took it for about a 2 mile test ride changing speed and gears both up and down hills along the way with no issues. Looks great and rides great for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Lover

customer_reviews.title: Road Bike 700c GMC from WalMart
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Have not had a road bike in a while. This is great for the price for me. A little heavy compared to other bikes but it is a GMC by General Motors 😂 The seat is the only thing not that great I think.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan42Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: the lightweight aluminum frame is so light that's what I love about this bike
customer_reviews.text: the Bike is okay, it is not a professional but it gets the job done, my pedals and water bottle holder were not red they were black, you have to adjust the brake pads but oh well, the lightweight aluminum frame is so light that's what I love about this bike, its not heavy at all...the tires gave out after 12 miles
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kent GMC Denali 700cc mens bike
customer_reviews.text: I have been riding this bike for about 18 months. I haven't had a single problem. I ride it mostly in county parks.
customer_reviews.author: bigbandsone

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money but needed help assembling it
customer_reviews.text: It a well built bike and it gets me where I need to go. However when it came out of the box, it did not come with any of the tools needed to assemble it. I found everything in needed except for the Allen wrench. I have a 9 piece Allen wrench but none were actually big enough so I had to take it to my local bike shop. Also be warned that the shifters are twist shifters and after a couple of months they became loose. I just pushed them back on, but I fear it might begin to be a bigger problem in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Markarius Nealis

customer_reviews.title: How to hook up a Denali
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these on craigslist for my lady and I... $125 for the PAIR!!! Hers was great... mine needed work. Got new wheels and a real seat (boteranger). Then i stripped all of the paint off and polished away. added upgraded shimano front and rear derailleurs with Jagwire pro cabling and a proper quick release chain. love the Denali
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Russo

product_meta.title: KENT 22.5" GMC Denali 700cc Men's Bike, White/Red
